title: The Day of the LORD
shortSummary: Zechariah 14 prophesies the coming day of the LORD when Jerusalem will be attacked by all nations, but God will intervene decisively to deliver His people. The chapter describes dramatic cosmic events, the establishment of God's kingdom, and the ultimate holiness and worship centered in Jerusalem. This chapter offers a vivid picture of final judgment and restoration, emphasizing God's sovereign rule and the call for all nations to worship Him.
timeline: Future prophetic event concerning the end times and the Messianic Kingdom

keyCharacters.name: Jerusalem
keyCharacters.description: The city at the center of the prophecy, representing God's chosen place and people, which will be attacked but ultimately delivered and restored.

keyCharacters.name: Judah
keyCharacters.description: The tribe and people who will fight at Jerusalem and participate in the final victory and worship of the LORD.

keyCharacters.name: Nations
keyCharacters.description: All the Gentile nations gathered against Jerusalem in battle, who will be judged and punished by God.

definitions.definition: A future time when God will intervene decisively in history to judge the wicked and establish His kingdom.
A mountain east of Jerusalem, significant as the place where the LORD will stand and cause a great earthquake at His coming.
A Jewish festival commemorating God's provision and presence, which in this prophecy becomes a universal time of worship to the LORD.
The goods or plunder taken from a defeated enemy, here referring to what will be divided among the attacking nations.

outline.heading: The Coming Siege and Divine Intervention
outline.description: The chapter opens with a prophecy of a great day when all nations will attack Jerusalem, resulting in suffering and captivity, but God will intervene miraculously, standing on the Mount of Olives and causing a massive earthquake to protect His people.

outline.heading: The Unique Day and Living Waters
outline.description: A mysterious day is described that is neither day nor night, marked by living waters flowing from Jerusalem, symbolizing life and blessing, and the LORD reigning as the one true King over all the earth.

outline.heading: Restoration and Safety of Jerusalem
outline.description: The land around Jerusalem will be transformed into a plain, and the city will be securely inhabited without destruction, signifying God's restoration and protection of His people.

outline.heading: Judgment on the Nations and Cosmic Conflict
outline.description: God will bring a devastating plague on those who fight against Jerusalem, causing confusion and destruction among men and animals, demonstrating His power to defend His city.

outline.heading: Universal Worship and Holiness
outline.description: Survivors of the nations will be required to worship the LORD annually in Jerusalem, with severe consequences for those who refuse, and the entire city and temple will be consecrated as holy to the LORD.

application: Trust in God's sovereign protection and deliverance even in times of great trial and opposition.
Commit to worshiping the LORD faithfully, recognizing Him as the one true King over all the earth.
Live in holiness, dedicating all aspects of life to the LORD as exemplified by the consecration of Jerusalem and its vessels.
Participate in the spiritual gathering of God's people, seeking unity in worship and obedience to His commands.

keyVerses.text: And his feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east, and the mount of Olives shall cleave in the midst thereof toward the east and toward the west, and there shall be a very great valley; and half of the mountain shall remove toward the north, and half of it toward the south.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the supernatural intervention of God in the final battle, emphasizing His power and presence in defending Jerusalem.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD shall be king over all the earth: in that day shall there be one LORD, and his name one.
keyVerses.significance: This verse declares the ultimate sovereignty of God as the one true King, uniting all creation under His rule.

keyVerses.text: And it shall come to pass, that every one that is left of all the nations which came against Jerusalem shall even go up from year to year to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, and to keep the feast of tabernacles.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the universal call to worship God and the establishment of Jerusalem as the center of true worship.

keyVerses.text: In that day shall there be upon the bells of the horses, HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD; and the pots in the LORD'S house shall be like the bowls before the altar.
keyVerses.significance: This verse illustrates the complete consecration and holiness that will characterize God's people and worship in the Messianic age.
